content.detailedDescription:
My 5 year old granddaughter was on the deck overlooking the pond at about 8pm when she said look at that red thing, maybe it's mars. we watched it for awhile and it pulsated a bit then moved very slightly. i dismissed it and we set out to light some fire works. suddenly i realized it was still there and was now made up of more orange lights, it started to move further east. i got out my binoculars and could see several orange lights, 3 or 4, maybe. it was starting to fade and i saw what looked like search light beams, then it just began to disappear. 
 this morning i ran into my next door neighbors who asked me if i had seen the strange glowing orange ball over the pond. we compared notes and were in complete agreement about what we all had seen.
content.summary: We first thought it was a planet about 30 degrees above horizon, maybe mars because it was reddish orange.But an hour later it was a bit higher, it had ascended and there were more lights.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving to work and as i was headed down 274 i seen a solid bright red light about the size of a lady bug, i travel 274 alot so i thought it was odd because i never seen that red light befor, but i didnt think much about it......As i kept driving east on 274 i noticed it was getting bigger,then not long after i notied that it turned direction to the north because i could see 3 light one being the red which was the one closes to me and directly across from the red was the solid blue light those 2 lights made the bottom of a triangle with one light in each cornor, at what would be the top of the triangle was the flashing white light.....This object was so close to me as i was stopped in the middle of 274 that i could see under neath it and it was clearly a solid blake triangle with just the 3 lights one on each point.....As i sat there looking up at it it kinda just glides through the sky headed in a north west direction making no noise how i know is because my window was down and my head was hanging out looking up at it.......I was kinda dumb founded at what i had just seen.....All i could do is text my husband and tell him what i had just seen knowing he was asleep.....My brain wasnt thinking normaland now i could kick myself in the butt for not taking a picture of it with my phone but like i said i was kinda dumb founded with the sighting
content.summary: It was a triangle ufo

content.detailedDescription: At our son's 3rd birthday party on july 3, 2012 at about 21:45, we were getting ready to start setting up for fireworks, when in the distance we (approximately 16 people) noticed a large semi-rigid pattern of lights about 1-2 miles away. the region is rural countryside, very low light pollution. it was flying in a circular pattern for about 10 minutes with a large radius to the flight path. during the observation, the lights would occasionally fade out and return, but with no set pattern to the fading and return to visibility. i had my camera (a canon dslr) and was able to snap 3 pictures. i was having difficulty focusing due to the distance and darkness. one picture came out fairly decent, but the other 2 suffer from camera shake. i zoomed in on the one good one and found 5 white lights and 1 red light.
content.summary: Large set pattern of lights seen in distance flying in circular pattern, occasionally fading out then returning for about 10 minutes.

content.detailedDescription: I first saw these lights on july 1 2012 around 11:20pm i had just got off work and as i was walking to my car i noticed a bright red-orange light moving east from the west. i noticed there were no blinking lights like you see on airplanes. then a second light just popped out a little north of the first. i went inside to get my manager and when we walked back outside there were now 6 lights spread  out in the sky they would move fast then slow down and then stop and just sit there. also a plane went by and it was way lower than the lights but the lights were much brighter than the airplane. now it is july 3rd at around 9:30pm i am outside on my break talking to a coworker about what my manager and i saw and i pointed to where the lights were and it showed up again this night there was a lot of cloud cover so it must have been low but it was bright and moving south as if from seal beach. this time about a group of 20 or so people had gotten together in front of the store. it moved slowly changing directions instantly and it seemed to be pulsing and would go out and come back like a light bulb going on and off till it stoped and shot straight up.  i was at the corner of beach blvd and slater ave at walgreens.
content.summary: Red orange lights moving around in the sky over huntington beach

content.detailedDescription: I was on the computer when my 19 yr old son calls me from his cell phone, he says come outside you won't believe this. when i went outside it was 5am and still dark here. in the eastern sky i saw 3 lighted objects. they together formed a flat triangle with the point of the triangle angled more upward then the back 2 corners and the point was toward the north, the 2 corners toward the south. each light had a different brightness to it which made me believe they one furthest away was dimmest, the brightest closest. the point of the triangle object was the more active of the 3 as it constantly dimmed and brightened and changed shape in what appeared to go from like a star to a long stick figure like shape. up and down. all 3 objects did the same type of shape change but all at different times, and at different speeds. the 2 corner objects appeared as if one was above the other but as already said, the dimmer of the two i believe was further away. this is also the one which appeared to be over the top of the other. the lower, brightest of the 3, was the least active and stayed brighter longer, changing shapes less often but was also the one most easy to see clearly. it appeared to have 2 appendages going outward from the top with 2 others going upward from the middle and 2 leg-looking things below. the appendages would disappear from bottom upward making the light look starlike briefly then the appendages would return. each object shape changed like the same way but at different intervals. me, my son and husband watched for an hour trying to come up with logical explaination but could not. and the just as my husband and i were about to go back inside, a 4th lighted object came flying out of nowhere and look like it was going to fly between the 2 south corner objects. and just as it approached them, the 4th flying object vanished. we continued watching a while longer and the flying object never was seen again anywhere in the sky after that. when we came inside the point object was no longer visible but the 2 southern objects continued as before. it was very hard to determine if the objects were hovering and stationary or if they were moving at an upward angle ever so so slowly. all of us thought at times we saw them ascending upward but yet never move. i can't find the right words to explain it all really let alone fully comprehend it. but i cannot logically explain any of it as being of human origin. this i know.
content.summary: 3 lights becoming long then small, starlike then long again. triangle shape. white lights. camera would not pick up. each light different appearance and movement. 3 witnesses

content.detailedDescription: I was in the army stationed in alaska in 87.We were in the field making a site jump when suddenly the convoy came to a halt.We all got out to look at this thing.It was very big,circular and glowing from underside.It moved back and forth and after about 5 mins it stopped then smaller round orbs came out of it until ther was nothing left.
content.summary: Huge round oval.Glowing like plasma.Moved sideways and back.Stopped then broke up into smaller orbs which all went in different directions

content.detailedDescription: Driving south on 55 heading towards crown point. about 1 mile south from rt 30 i noticed a red glowing orb heading east ans slightly south. i could be over hyles college. it was flickering or pulsating orange and red then it vanished in mid air. it never really looked like a airplane. it seemed to have the speed of a helicopter.
content.summary: Orb traveled between schererville and crown point. in a slight south east direction. then varnished in thin air.

content.detailedDescription:
Husband and i stepped out on the balcony because we heard fireworks and wanted to see if we could see them from our balcony(we could only see the very top of the biggest fireworks over the trees to the west). we noticed them right away. there were 7 bright orange lights in a loose v shape across the sky.If there were more, we could not see them because our building would have been blocking them from view. they were moving from the west to east at a steady pace. there was no sound from them. as they reached almost directly in front and above of us, one toward the north of the formation stopped and hovered. one by one, they all got smaller and faded from view (like they were ascending quickly, maybe), and only the one hovering remained. we watched it for a moment, and then it too got smaller and faded from view without moving position.

within less than a minute, there were two planes in the sky, heading in the same  general direction. my first thought was that those planes were 'together' because they were so close to each other in the sky. one headed north and the other headed east. it was too dark to see what kind of planes they were. the orange lights were much brighter than the planes but looked smaller from our viewpoint (maybe they were higher in the sky?), but seemed to be traveling at close to the same speed as the planes.

the planes were still in the sky, but almost gone, when we saw another orange light to the west. i ran into the house and grabbed the binoculars. when i returned, there was another one in the sky, both traveled in that same direction. looking at them through the binoculars, i could see that they were pulsating in a steady rhythm from bright to brighter. i could not really see that without the binoculars. there was no detail that could be seen, just orange light. those got smaller and faded until they could not be seen even with the binoculars.  another one appeared in the sky, just winking into view about halfway up from the horizon to the northwest. same direction of travel, same fading and disappearing after about a minute. i lost count of how many there were altogether, but they kept appearing in the west, one or two at a time and traveling in the same direction, usually fading within a minute or two. i think there were approximately 14 to 18 in all.
content.summary: Bright orange lights in formation with others a few minutes after, one by one

content.detailedDescription: I was asleep but awoken to a strange figure sitting on me. i was paralized but could see the being. it did only one thing and that was to tickle me. i laughed so much i couldn't breath. the being left through the window. passing thought it rather than opening it.  it was grey and had stringy hair, not what we have but horse tail like. it came back 2 more times. always the same ,only for what i can describe as amusement more than anything. a military canadian service man lived not to far away and said he saw a craft that corresponds with the times. he will remain unavailable always due to his service to the canadian military. i didn't imagine this, until now i've had no one to tell. well i'm telling and don't care if you believe me or not.
content.summary: Close encounter 4th kind

content.detailedDescription: Around 10:30 pm on july 3rd was sitting outside talking to my sister on the phone and saw a bright orange orb between some trees and looked like it came from the ground up and move from west to east .Scared the crap out of me ...I ran inside to call my son outside all he got was some of it threw another set of trees that it had moved passed then could not see it anymore because of the trees..Some crazy stuff..I know for a facted it was no airplane or anything but what i saw..Im from illinois..Did anyone else see this tonight??
content.summary: Bright orange orb

content.detailedDescription:
i just opened the door to take my dogs out for the night when i looked up an saw this very bright orange light traveling southeast then east. as soon as i saw it i yelled for my brother to come outside. when he got there it was behind the trees but we moved to a better view and we saw it move east in a wobbly motion. 
  when i first saw it i thought it was a firework, but after a few seconds of it not going off or falling to the ground i did not know what to think of it, neither did my brother. we both looked at it in amazement and confusion because we did not know what it was and when it was gone my brother told me i should have gotten my camera, but told him i would have missed everything if i had went inside.
  we lost sight of the object after about 3-5 minutes when it moved into the distance and below the distant trees. as it moved away it was still very bright but just a little dimmer.

  there were fireworks going off but to the west of my location, where as the object was to the south. i waited for along time to see if there was any fireworks in that area and there was not.


i only put my email. if you email me i will get back to you 100% where as i almost never have my phone on or near me.
content.summary: Orange light above the tree line moving south then east

content.detailedDescription: About two football feilds wide about a mile across with little people in the windows,us for somthing or not.

content.altitude: Treetop, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
I was driving on 69 hwy toward excelsior springs, the sighting took place approximately 2-3 minutes before reaching stoplight by walmart, near wooded area with large grassy/wooded median.

saw what i first thought was a non-disintegrating piece of a firework, then realized it wasn't going away and was hovering.  it was an orange glowing ball that continued to hover not far from my car as i drove.  i watched it as it hovered for a minute, then slowly move toward my left, hover for another minute, then slowly ascent.  within approximately 15 seconds it went from being relatively close to my car to looking like a star in the sky, then disappeared completely.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange glowing ball hovers then ascents

content.detailedDescription: I was comming home from the fire works that the city put on. i did not want to go home right away so i started driving out on the outskirts of town where there is no people living and mostly old abondon houses. i drive a newer car so no problems with the raido. the music started to fade in and out and cut out all together. but before that happen a weird noise came apon my speakers and it sounded like a half of some type of word. it is a sound that will always be in my head. as i glance out my window i saw some lighting as i thought it was more fireworks but the lights were still at first. then i stopped on the side of the road and saw the lights started to move. they were moving up and down but in a slow moving way. it kind of felt like time was slowing down. i could not belive what i was seeing. i have seen a few ufo's in mississippi but not this close to me. with in the time i was able to grasp at what i was looking at it started to flot up and into the clouds and disappered like it had a camo of the clouds that were comming in from a storm. this area has open farm lands in this area also. i will keep watch on any news of missing or dead animals. the ufo itself was hard to see for what shape it was. as i moving around   the shape was not fully oval but more of a triangle with a oval end. the lights on it were a light green with hints of white in them. and it also had a single light that was i redish orange. when i fist saw the ufo it made my heart skip because it was like walking up on a snake. the feeling of a low electric current start comming over my body. i was able to move and pull over my car to step out to get a better look. my judgement the ufo was there some time before i got there and was in the process of leaving when i drove up.
content.summary: Short time over tree tops feeling no noise but having a light electric feel in the air

content.summary: Short time over tree tops feeling no noise but having a light electric feel in the air

content.detailedDescription: We were leaving the red white and boom fireworks in columbus ohio. the fireworks ended at approximately 10:25pm as we were leaving the bridge,where we were viewing the fireworks. at approximately 10:30pm my girlfriend stops me and says whats that in the sky, so we stopped and i looked at the objects which had a blue/purple glow almost like a black light. i had no idea what they were, i just know they were not any aircraft i have ever witnessed. there were 5 to 6 in the main group,and in a very loose formation with one of the objects trailing behind the others. they moved very slowly in a straight path in a slight northeast direction for close to 3 minutes,before they faded out. there were many helicopters and planes in the sky as this is a huge event and these were distinctly different. i tried to get video on my camera and i believe i caught the trailing object for a brief moment as the others were obscured by the street lights, but cannot be sure it is not just an artifact of the street lights. i know the people we were standing beside during the fireworks stopped with us to view the objects. im not sure how many people saw this as there were thousands leaving the area. i was very excited to witness this, my girlfriend seemed a bit less enthusiastic about it but kept calling them aliens,as we discussed what we saw while walking back to our vehicle.
content.summary: Witnessed 6-7 glowing bluish glowing objects in a loose formation 1 trailing behind

content.detailedDescription:
We had just moved to the mountains near trinidad, co. my daughter was about three at the time. she did not want to go to bed because she was scared. i went to her room and laid down with her. i asked her what she was scared of and she described an event she said happened the night before. she said she woke up in the night and saw a little person standing next to her bed. she said it was looking at her toys. she then said it turned and looked right at her and she said she then ran to my room. i asked her what the person did, and she just said tha it was standing there. mind you, this is coming from a three year old and i didn't want to hate her with questions because i wanted only her account of the event. some of it was sketchy, but i did manage to get her to tell me that it didn't touch or hurt her. i then got a piece of paper and a black marker and asked her if she could draw mommy a picture. she drew a fairly good picture of what looked like a little man that she said was gray in color. she did emphasize to me that it's eyes had these lines on them like a bumble bee stripes but in a grid pattern. i
she said it was yellow and black. i got her a yellow marker and she colored in the eyes a bit and wanted me to help her draw the grid pattern in black. i asked her if it had a mouth or did it talk to her and she said it had sharp little teeth but didn't speak. i asked her if the face scared her and she said no, only when it looked at her did she get scared. that's all the info i could get. i don't know if it was a dream, fantasy, or true, but i never allowed her access to anything remotely like it on tv or books, so i'm not sure where she suddenly got such a detailed image. i'll always wonder about it, though. she suffers from a learning disability,  dyslexia, and has trouble with focusing on a task. as a baby, we never had any notion that she might have these difficulties. they began after we moved to that house. now we live in texas and she is doing much better. she's eight now. she insisted back then that she wasn't dreaming and that it was real. it was pretty frightening for her and me.
content.summary: Daughter claims a little gray man was in her bedroom looking at her toys then her.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were looking south at the night sky when we noticed a red/orange object coming our direction, heading north. we could tell right away that it wasn't a plane because of the round shape.  my wife went in the house to get the binoculors to get a better look.  when we viewed the object through the binoculors it appeared to be on fire with red flames. it was very fast moving and was out of our sight in 3 minutes or less going north toward the horizon.
content.summary: Red fireball shape appeared in the clear sky as we were looking south from our porch and continued north until out of view.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were looking south at the night sky when we noticed a red/orange object coming our direction, heading north. we could tell right away that it wasn't a plane because of the round shape.  my wife went in the house to get the binoculors to get a better look.  when we viewed the object through the binoculors it appeared to be on fire with red flames. it was very fast moving and was out of our sight in 3 minutes or less going north toward the horizon.
content.summary: Red fireball shape appeared in the clear sky as we were looking south from our porch and continued north until out of view.

content.altitude: Treetop, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
Around 10:20 pm we were outside sitting in our pool. we live southeast, just outside of wanamaker, in. we saw first one very bright, unflickering, orange fireball. it looked like it might have been a misfired firework, but it continued east without losing altitude. before this object flew out of sight, another bright orange ball appeared. this one was different though- it headed north, the orange light disappeared and it was just a black object. it went over several houses and i swear it landed on someone's roof or yard. then a few minutes later, a third orange light headed east, then disappeared.

there were airplanes in the sky before and after we saw this, and they looked completely different-- i was thinking maybe the air quality or smog was distorting the lights, but that didn't seem to be the case. oh, and there was no noise coming from them, and they all came from the same exact direction in the sky- northwest.
content.summary: 3 orange lights headed east

content.detailedDescription: Just finished watching country club fireworks and walked with friends back to my nearby house.  i saw a very bright orb appear in the southern horizon and observed it fly directly overhead before disapearing into the northern horizon.  it was traveling very quickly and appeared to be on fire or giving off a firey trail.  the object almost had a triangle or diamond shape, but was very distant.  i know it was not a firework because of the distance traveled and i know it wasnt a plane because of the speed and color.  it emmitted an almost flame like appearance that flickered a little but was a contant color.  i know others had to see it, and my friends and i couldnt explain it.
content.summary: Firey orb, traveled at extreme rate from horizon to horizon

content.detailedDescription: I was about 16 years old, and i was sitting in the back seat of my mother's volvo on our way home. she was driving, and her friend was in the front passenger seat. the moon roof of the vehicle was open, and we were talking about a tragic auto accident that was in the news. we were at the intersection of hulen st. and i-25 in fairly heavy traffic at the stoplight to turn left under the bridge and drive towards overton park. it was night, and i was talking while looking out of the moon roof from the back seat. i saw something unusual, and i sat forward to focus in on it. in the sky, hovering low, were three orange-red lights in a triangle formation. i appeared to be directly above the traffic in the right oncoming lanes. it was a triangle formation, and i remember getting my mother's attention to look at it. it seemed to be hovering, then as our light turned green and my mother moved forward into the intersection to make the left turn, i could tell the lights were moving slowly in the same direction and at one point were directly above us. i could not see any body or mass to whatever it was, but i remember that i thought it was really strange that it blocked out the view of what little stars were in the sky. i remember feeling a bit of panic, and i didn't take my eyes off of it. as we drove under the bridge, i watched to see it as we came out of the other side and it was completely gone. vanished. i have ways wondered what it could have been and speculated that perhaps i had witnessed a ufo or strange military craft.
content.summary: Medium invisible triangle with red corner lights hovered then moved.

content.detailedDescription:
Do not call me, do not!

is our gov. using any type of square orange boxes for any type
of surveillance that you are aware of?
these boxes were extremely extremely fast!

do not call me,  i do not believe in this!

ca
content.summary: How far can a hologram be brodcast?

content.detailedDescription: My neighbors were lighting fireworks approximately 300 yards to the north of my house. my wife and i came out on the deck at 9:30 pm and watched for a few minutes. she grabbed me and said "what's that?". i turned and looked to the southwest and saw a glowing ball of what appeared to be a flame approaching at a high altitude. there were no fireworks being set off from that direction and the wind was coming from the northwest. the object glided at a steady but not fast pace. i ran in to get the binoculars. the object was heading in a northeasterly direction. a closer look revealed a ball type object that appeared to be on fire. i thought maybe it was a glowing piece of firework, but it appeared to be too high in the sky and movied at a steady pace against the wind. the object continued to travel until it appeared to go above the cloud cover. it made no sound and was observed for about three minutes. we both have never seen anything like it.
content.summary: Neighbors lighting fireworks to the north. object came from southwest and flew to the northeast before disappearing

content.detailedDescription:
The attached was taken with a small nokia cell phone. the photo is completely original.
the photo was taken in a westerly direction at the beach at oceanside harbor, oceanside, ca.
the black line attracted my attention because it was completly straight in spite of what looks like high altitude winds affecting the white vapor trails from, what looks like, rocket trails fired from norton afb.
what ever it was appears to be above the weather.
i'd love to know what is was.
content.summary: Straight, black line in sky.  high altitude unaffected by prevailing winds.
